m_szDocTitle: Green nanotech to power cars: IIT-M researchers show how - Times of India
m_szDocSumamry: Green nanotech to power cars: IIT-M researchers show how U Tejonmayam At a time when India has pledged to reduce carbon emissions by 33% to 35% by 2030 and is looking for non-fossil fuelbased sources to generate electricity, Indian Institute of Technology-Madras researchers have come up with what they say is an alternate cost-effective green nanotechnology to power vehicles like hybrid cars and bikes. | TNN | Dec 29, 2015, 06.09 AM IST CHENNAI: At a time when India has pledged to reduce carbon emissions by 33% to 35% by 2030 and is looking for non-fossil fuelbased sources to generate electrici
